meanings.definition: To guide or direct a vehicle or vessel in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: She was outsteering the boat towards the shore.
meanings.sent2: The captain excelled at outsteering the ship through rough waters.
meanings.sent3: The little duckling tried outsteering its siblings in a race across the pond.
meanings.sent4: His intuition was like a compass, always outsteering him towards success.
meanings.sent5: Outsteering the car through traffic felt like a dance of precision.

meanings.definition: To surpass or outperform in steering or navigating.
meanings.sent1: The experienced pilot was outsteering all the other competitors in the air race.
meanings.sent2: The new technology allowed the driver to outsteer any obstacles on the road.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed to be outsteering the birds in finding the hidden nuts.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was outsteering her fear, propelling her towards her goals.
meanings.sent5: Outsteering the competition, he secured the first-place trophy.
